definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: Any unexpected misfortune happened to my son， I would not live any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我的兒子要是有個三長兩短，我就不想活了。

sentences.english: If anything should happen to you, I don't want to live.
sentences.chinese: 你要有個三長兩短，我也不想活了。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
